page.title: 09WESTON VILLAGE FLOUR MILL.
page.content: The{flour mill}was built in{1860}and is a mile from the village centre. The first owners emigrated to America and the mill was taken over by the {Pryors, an important Hertfordshire {family.}Their descendants, including a pupil at the school, now live there. The Mill is one of the few now remaining in Hertfordshire. All the{machinery}has been taken out of the mill but there is a mill stone in front of the house covering a well. There are two{adjacent fields used for {cattle or hay}, it was probably used for grazing or corn before when the first owners lived there.{Planning {permission}is now being sought to turn the mill into a house by joining the mill tower onto an existing barn. This will arrest decay. Permission for this has recently been refused by the local authority.
